articles.title: Western Europe cleans up after Storm Eunice leaves destruction and at least 12 dead - ABC News
articles.description: At least 12 people are dead, many killed by falling trees, in Ireland, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands and Germany after one of the most damaging storms in years tore through western Europe.
articles.content:
Crews are clearing fallen trees and working to restore power to about 400,000 people in the UK as western Europe cleans up after one of the most damaging storms in years.

articles.author: Jacob Paul
articles.title: EU scrambles to keep up with UK in new wind farm push: 'Need more!' - Daily Express
articles.description: THE EU is scrambling to keep up with the UK's significant progress in offshore wind after the European Parliament demanded that the bloc rapidly scales up the energy source so it can meet climate targets on schedule.
